intro: Baphia marquesii, commonly known as the Marquesas baphia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the South Pacific. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, which includes many plants with nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in coastal or lowland areas, thriving in humid and warm climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
